footer.motto:
A new type of navigation application
that can be used on railroad lines throughout Japan

welcome.canBeUsed: Can be used on railroad lines throughout Japan
welcome.description:
The train vision that you can use with your smartphone, which has never been possible before.
That's TrainLCD, a new kind of navigation app!
When you feel lost, when you are not sure if you can get off the train. It will surely be useful for you.

serviceArea.description: With a few exceptions, most of Japan's nationwide Railroad lines are supported.
serviceArea.disclaimer: Service is not guaranteed for some routes where signal reception is difficult, such as subways, and for intricate routes such as the Tsurumi Line. The service is only available for railroad lines and not for buses or other means of transportation.

tablet.description:
With the iPad, you can find out the next station more easily.
The app is compatible with any of the latest iPads, so you can use it comfortably as soon as you download it.
You can download the app and start using it right away.
tablet.disclaimer: The Wi-Fi model iPad does not support GPS and may become unstable under certain conditions.

wearable.shortHeading: Are you in a crowded train?
wearable.description: By combining an Apple Watch or a smartwatch with Wear OS by Google, you can know the current stop and the next stop just by looking at your wrist.
wearable.disclaimer: Wear OS by Google requires an Android smartphone to be paired with the device; it cannot be used if paired with an iPhone.

oss.description:
TrainLCD is an MIT-licensed open source project.
Engineers, would you like to contribute to the development of TrainLCD?

dl.description:
It is compatible with iPhone, iPad, and Android smartphones, and of course it is free.
Get it working on your smartphone ASAP!
